bestBHT.bht: The emphasis is on Jesus turning to the paralytic and addressing him, demonstrating compassion and intentionality. By instructing the man to take up his bed and go home, Jesus not only showed the completeness of the cure but also empowered him to reintegrate into society. It was an authoritative command given in the presence of all the people, proving the extent of the healing. Through this act, Jesus encouraged the man to return to his family and friends, sharing the good news of his restoration.

Henry Alford: The words are precisely those used, as so often in Mark,—and denote the turning to the paralytic and addressing him.
There may have been something in his state, which required the emphatic address.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: This taking up the portable couch
was designed to prove the completeness of the cure.
Go thy way into thine house
John Gill: He bid him, in an authoritative way to arise from his bed, in which he was brought, and on which he lay before him, and take it up upon his shoulders, directly, and in the face of all the people, carry it away.
To show himself whole to his family and friends, and go about his business.
Go thy way into thine house.

bhtAttempts.bht: The emphasis of this verse is on the turning to the paralytic and addressing him. This shows the compassion and intentionality of Jesus towards the man's condition. By instructing him to take up his bed and go home, Jesus not only demonstrated the completeness of the cure but also empowered the man to reintegrate into society and resume his normal life. It was an authoritative command, given in the presence of all the people, to show the extent of the healing. Through this act, Jesus encouraged the man to go back to his family and friends, sharing the good news of his restoration.

The emphasis is on Jesus turning to the paralytic and addressing him, demonstrating compassion and intentionality. By instructing the man to take up his bed and go home, Jesus not only showed the completeness of the cure but also empowered him to reintegrate into society. It was an authoritative command given in the presence of all the people, proving the extent of the healing. Through this act, Jesus encouraged the man to return to his family and friends, sharing the good news of his restoration.

The emphasis is on Jesus turning to the paralytic and addressing him directly. This shows both the compassion and intention behind his words. By instructing the man to take up his bed and go home, Jesus not only demonstrates the completeness of the cure but also empowers him to reintegrate into society. It is an authoritative command, given in the presence of all the people, to show the extent of the healing. Through this act, Jesus encourages the man to return to his family and friends and resume his normal life.

The emphasis in this passage lies in the turning of Jesus to the paralytic and addressing him directly. This highlights both the compassion and intentionality of Jesus towards the man's condition. By instructing him to take up his bed and go home, Jesus not only exhibits the completeness of the cure but also empowers the man to reintegrate into society. This command, given in front of the onlooking crowd, exemplifies the extent of the healing. Ultimately, Jesus encourages the man to return to his household and share the news of his restoration.

The emphasis is on Jesus turning to the paralytic and addressing him directly. This demonstrates both compassion and intentionality towards the man's condition. Instructing him to take up his bed and go home, Jesus showcases the completeness of the cure and empowers the man to reintegrate into society. This authoritative command, witnessed by all, highlights the extent of the healing. Jesus encourages the man to return to his household and share the news of his restoration with family and friends.
